messages.title: Re-elect Alan Whitehead on 12th December
messages.content: Almost everyone knows someone who has been helped by Alan Whitehead and many know about his work in Parliament on the climate emergency, energy, housing and education. We’ve been told time and time again that he’s been a good MP and people want to see him re-elected. To do that you’ll have to vote for Alan Whitehead on Thursday December 12th. Don’t leave it to chance.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Alan Whitehead has worked in Parliament on the climate emergency and has been a leader on these issues.
Alan Whitehead has worked in Parliament on energy issues and has been a leader on these issues.
Alan Whitehead has worked in Parliament on housing issues.
Alan Whitehead has worked in Parliament on education issues.

mentions.candidate: Alan Whitehead has been a good MP and people want to see him re-elected.
mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: The alternative is a Tory MP who would blindly follow a Tory Prime Minister, helping them sell off the NHS in a trade deal with Trump.
mentions.tacticalSituation: Only a vote for Alan Whitehead can stop the Conservatives winning in Southampton Test.

issues.education: Alan Whitehead has worked in Parliament on education issues. Pam supports Alan for his commitment to working towards a much fairer education system.
issues.environment: Alan Whitehead has worked in Parliament on the climate emergency and has been a leader on these issues. Pam endorses Alan for his longstanding record of commitment to environmental issues and climate change.
issues.health: Sue supports Alan because he will fight for a well-funded NHS.
issues.lawCrime: There is a mention of tackling crime, but no specific details provided.

community.content: Sue supports Alan for his help on personal family concerns, like better-funded schools and preschools. Pam supports Alan for his work tirelessly for the benefit of the community as a whole.

politicalExperience.achievements: Hardworking MP known for his work on energy, climate change, education, housing, and health issues.

endorsements.endorsement: I’m backing Alan at this election as he’s well known as a hard working MP for the area. I’m also very impressed with the work he’s done around energy and climate change. He’s always been a leader on these issues.

I have trusted Alan as my MP for many years. He is a caring person and very active in several areas of my personal family concerns, e.g. better-funded schools and preschools. I can rely on the Labour Party to press for a well-funded NHS with no risk of USA involvement, and put right the current injustice to the poor and homeless.

I am very happy to endorse Alan as Labour Party Candidate in this election as he has always been a very strong constituency MP who has worked tirelessly for the benefit of our community as a whole. Alongside this he has a longstanding record of commitment to environmental issues and climate change, and I believe will continue to work towards a much fairer education system.
